sense.name: (cause to) break or separate abruptly
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 SNAP NP2 NOTE: Includes metaphorical uses.
sense.examples: The rope snapped, and the crate plummeted to the ground. He could snap your neck in two. Snap off a square of that chocolate for me. The victory also snapped a three-game losing streak against the Earthquakes.

sense.name: (cause to) move abruptly, often making a short, sharp sound
sense.examples: The door of the trap snapped shut, with the rat securely inside. Once he lined it up correctly, it snapped into place. The flag snapped in the breeze. I snapped on the light. She always snaps her phone shut one-handed. The police snapped the handcuffs around her wrists. Marla snapped around, a look of fury on her face.

sense.name: make a short, sharp sound
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to sense 4. This sense DOES NOT include any sound made with the fingers.
sense.examples: Rice Crispies: they Snap, Crackle and Pop! The fire snapped and crackled cheerfully on the hearth.

sense.name: use the fingers of one hand to make a snapping sound
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to sense 3. This sense only involves making a sound with the fingers.
sense.examples: I didn't learn to snap until I was seven. They all snapped in time with the music. Kat snapped and everyone in the room jumped.

sense.name: utter in a sharp and angry tone
sense.commentary: NOTE: When following or preceding a direct quote, always use this sense. (As in example 2).
sense.examples: He snapped back a reply, annoyed that she had asked. 'Just give me the check,' she snapped.

sense.name: seize; grasp at something
sense.commentary: Synax is: NP1[animate] SNAP NP2 INCLUDES: SNAP UP
sense.examples: The fish snapped at the bait. He snapped at any chance he could get to be near her. She snapped up all the good bargains.

sense.name: undergo an abrupt change in mental condition
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[animate] SNAP NOTE: Compare to Senses 1 and 2: Sense 7 is intransitive.
sense.examples: She snapped awake at the sound. Will you snap out of it?! When his daughter died, he just snapped.

sense.name: take a photograph
sense.examples: She snapped a picture of the senator as he left the restaurant.

sense.name: SPORTS: put the ball into play or execute a play.
sense.examples: A moment after he snapped the ball, Miller was hit by a linebacker.
